newsitem.title: HONG KONG: K. Wah sells property for HK$733 mln.
newsitem.headline: K. Wah sells property for HK$733 mln.

text.p: K. Wah International Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday it will sell a residential property in Repulse Bay for HK$733 million to an independent third party.

The property, Royal Garden, is a 12-storey residential building comprising 24 apartments with a total building area of about 60,648 sq feet, and has 36 car parking spaces and a swimming pool, it said in a statement.

It generated gross rental incomes of HK$18.64 million and HK$20.67 million for the years ended March 31, 1995 and 1996 respectively. K. Wah said the corresponding net profits after taxation were HK$4.21 million and HK$2.94 million for fiscal 1995 and 1996.
The deal is expected to be completed on or before March 24, 1997, it said.
The company planned to apply the proceeds derived from the disposal to provide for additional working capital and to reduce bank borrowings of the K. Wah Group.
